contentList.content: Wizards can learn new Spells by transcribing Spell scrolls to their Spellbook in exchange for gold. Scrolls are destroyed once transcribed.
Utilized to recover <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slots</LSTag> through <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_ArcaneRecovery">Arcane Channeling</LSTag>.
Use your knowledge of the Weave around you in order to replenish your <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slots</LSTag>.
Spend 1 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ArcaneRecoveryPoint">Arcane Recovery</LSTag> charge in order to acquire a level one <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag>.
Spend 2 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ArcaneRecoveryPoint">Arcane Recovery</LSTag> charges in order to acquire a level two <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag>.
Spend 3 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ArcaneRecoveryPoint">Arcane Recovery</LSTag> charges in order to acquire a level three <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag>.
Spend 4 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ArcaneRecoveryPoint">Arcane Recovery</LSTag> charges in order to acquire a level four <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag>.
Spend 5 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ArcaneRecoveryPoint">Arcane Recovery</LSTag> charges in order to acquire a level five <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag>.
Spend 6 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ArcaneRecoveryPoint">Arcane Recovery</LSTag> charges in order to acquire a level six <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag>.
Upon casting a Spell, restore one of your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ArcaneRecoveryPoint">Arcane Recovery</LSTag> charges.
Once per turn, you may spend 3 charges of your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ArcaneRecoveryPoint">Arcane Recovery</LSTag> in order to recover your <LSTag Tooltip="Action">Action</LSTag>.

Spend 3 charges of your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ArcaneRecoveryPoint">Arcane Recovery</LSTag> in order to receive an additional <LSTag Tooltip="Action">Action</LSTag> for the rest of your turn.
The cost to learn Transmutation Spells from scrolls is reduced by half.
The cost to learn Conjuration Spells from scrolls is reduced by half.
The cost to learn Divination Spells from scrolls is reduced by half.
The cost to learn Evocation Spells from scrolls is reduced by half.
The cost to learn Necromancy Spells from scrolls is reduced by half.
The cost to learn Illusion Spells from scrolls is reduced by half.
The cost to learn Abjuration Spells from scrolls is reduced by half.
The cost to learn Enchantment Spells from scrolls is reduced by half.
The arcane and swordplay have always gone hand in hand for you. Over time, you have become a vertiable storm of steel and magic alike.

Gain <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_SteelWindStorm">Steel-Wind Storm</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_SteelWindBeam">Steel-Wind Burst</LSTag>, and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_SteelWindStrike">Steel-Wind Strike</LSTag>.
This action utilizes a weapon based <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> while also functioning as a Spell.
This action utilizes a weapon based <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> while also functioning as a <LSTag Tooltip="Cantrip">Cantrip</LSTag>.

Invoke the Arcane winds which guide you, granting a +1 bonus to your <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on all melee based <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>.

Affected creature has a +1 bonus to their <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on all melee based <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>.
While not <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FLANKED">Threatened</LSTag>, teleport to a nearby creature in the blink of an eye and strike them with your equipped weapon.
Fire a beam of pure Arcane energy, carrying the properties of your blade toward a target of your choice.

In combat, you may siphon the Arcane energy from the fallen. Doing so restores charges of <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ArcaneRecoveryPoint">Arcane Recovery</LSTag> equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> and infuses your weapon with <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="ARCANE_FORCE">Arcane Force</LSTag> for three turns.

Siphon the Arcane energy from the fallen, restoring charges of <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ArcaneRecoveryPoint">Arcane Recovery</LSTag> equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> and infusing your weapon with <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="ARCANE_FORCE">Arcane Force</LSTag> for three turns.

Once per turn, upon landing a killing blow or <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag>, you may cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_SteelWindStrike">Steel-Wind Strike</LSTag> as a free action.
Affected creature may cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_SteelWindStrike">Steel-Wind Strike</LSTag> as a free action.

Upon casting <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_SteelWindStrike">Steel-Wind Strike</LSTag>, a <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CLOAKOFDAGGERS">Cloak of Daggers</LSTag> is created under each of your targets for three turns. The strength of your Cloak of Daggers changes depending on the level of <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag> used.
Deals [1] to all enemies within the cloak.
Affected creature is taking [1] each turn.
Amidst a blend of steel and magic, you twist and harden the Weave into Arcane Wards to protect yourself and others.

The first Spell you cast each turn charges a magical ward around you. The ward absorbs damage done to you equal to the number of charges remaining. When it is reduced to 0 charges remaining, you take the remaining damage.

Casting Spells adds charges to the ward equal to the level of the Spell cast. The maximum amount of ward charges you may have at any time is equal to your level in Wizard.

Affected creature is protected by an Arcane Ward. Arcane Wards block damage equal to the amount of charges it currently has left, then loses 1 charge. Casting Spells will add charges to the ward equal to the level of the Spell cast.
When a nearby ally is about to take damage and you have an active <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="ARCANE_WARD">Arcane Ward</LSTag>, you can utilize your Ward to reduce the damage they take.

When a nearby ally is about to take damage, use your <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="ArcaneWard">Arcane Ward</LSTag> to reduce the damage by an amount equal equal to its charges. Afterwards, your Arcane Ward loses 1 charge.

When you are about to take damage, use your <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="ArcaneWard">Arcane Ward</LSTag> to reduce the damage by an amount equal equal to its charges. Afterwards, your Arcane Ward loses 1 charge.
Once per turn, dealing damage will charge one stack of your <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="ARCANE_WARD">Arcane Ward</LSTag>.

Being damaged by a melee based <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> deals Force damage to your aggressor equal to the amount of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="ARCANE_WARD">Arcane Ward</LSTag> charges you have remaining.
As an evoker, you stride unharmed through the unfettered chaos you call, a storm of mysicism contained only by the flick of your wrist.
Create pockets of safety within damaging Spells that you directly cast. Allies will take no damage from them.
When casting a Spell that makes an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>, you roll with <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag>.

Upon casting a Spell, restore one of your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ArcaneRecoveryPoint">Arcane Recovery</LSTag> charges. A <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag> must be consumed in order for this effect to trigger.

You add your <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Intelligence Modifier</LSTag> to the damage roll of the first Spell you cast each turn. When casting Spells which allow for multiple targets, only the first target selected will receive this damage bonus.
Once per cast, when dealing damage with a Spell, all enemies within [1] of your target take Force damage equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Intelligence Modifier</LSTag>.
The first Spell you cast each turn will not cost an <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ActionPoint">Action</LSTag> or <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">Bonus Action</LSTag>.
Amidst depraved conjurations, you walk comfortably within the shadow of death, making your home there in spite of the living.
Dealing damage will permanently apply <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CRAWLING_GNAW_SWITCH">Crawling Gnaw</LSTag> to your target.
When you deal damage with a Spell, you recover <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">Hit Points</LSTag> equal to half of the total damage dealt.
All allied Undead within [1] gain a bonus to their <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> and damage equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Intelligence Modifier</LSTag>.
At the beginning of any combat encounter, you immediately summon a Death Shepherd.
Your summoned Undead are immune to the effects of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="ZOMBIE_DECAY">Decay</LSTag>.
At the beginning of any combat encounter, all suitable corpses within [1] are raised as Undead.

While in combat, at the start of each of your turns you gain one Scholarly Acumen. Scholarly Acumen assign various tasks for you complete in order to further your knowledge of the arcane. Upon completing these tasks, you recover a charge of <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ArcaneRecoveryPoint">Arcane Recovery</LSTag>.
For completing your assigned study, you have recovered a charge of <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ArcaneRecoveryPoint">Arcane Recovery</LSTag>.
Upon dealing [1], recover one charge of <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ArcaneRecoveryPoint">Arcane Recovery</LSTag>.
You have recovered one charge of <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ArcaneRecoveryPoint">Arcane Recovery</LSTag> for free this turn.
Upon landing a killing blow or <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag>, recover one charge of <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ArcaneRecoveryPoint">Arcane Recovery</LSTag>.

Upon casting a Spell or <LSTag Tooltip="Cantrip">Cantrip</LSTag> belonging to the Transmutation school, recover one charge of <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ArcaneRecoveryPoint">Arcane Recovery</LSTag>.

Upon casting a Spell or <LSTag Tooltip="Cantrip">Cantrip</LSTag> belonging to the Abjuration school, recover one charge of <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ArcaneRecoveryPoint">Arcane Recovery</LSTag>.

Upon casting a Spell or <LSTag Tooltip="Cantrip">Cantrip</LSTag> belonging to the Conjuration school, recover one charge of <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ArcaneRecoveryPoint">Arcane Recovery</LSTag>.

Upon casting a Spell or <LSTag Tooltip="Cantrip">Cantrip</LSTag> belonging to the Divination school, recover one charge of <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ArcaneRecoveryPoint">Arcane Recovery</LSTag>.

Upon casting a Spell or <LSTag Tooltip="Cantrip">Cantrip</LSTag> belonging to the Enchantment school, recover one charge of <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ArcaneRecoveryPoint">Arcane Recovery</LSTag>.

Upon casting a Spell or <LSTag Tooltip="Cantrip">Cantrip</LSTag> belonging to the Evocation school, recover one charge of <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ArcaneRecoveryPoint">Arcane Recovery</LSTag>.

Upon casting a Spell or <LSTag Tooltip="Cantrip">Cantrip</LSTag> belonging to the Illusion school, recover one charge of <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ArcaneRecoveryPoint">Arcane Recovery</LSTag>.

Upon casting a Spell or <LSTag Tooltip="Cantrip">Cantrip</LSTag> belonging to the Necromancy school, recover one charge of <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ArcaneRecoveryPoint">Arcane Recovery</LSTag>.

Amidst the tapestry of magic, you weave as a purveyor of influence.
Within this knowledge, indelible power manifests.

Gain the ability to interrupt any Spell by utilizing your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ReactionActionPoint">Reaction</LSTag>. Upon doing so, your maximum <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ArcaneRecoveryPoint">Arcane Recovery</LSTag> charges are reduced by 1 until your next <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.

Interrupt any Spell. Upon doing so, your maximum <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ArcaneRecoveryPoint">Arcane Recovery</LSTag> charges are reduced by 1 until your next <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>. This <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ReactionActionPoint">Reaction</LSTag> cannot be used once you have exhausted all of your Arcane Recovery Charges.
When damaged by a melee based <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>, release a shockwave which forces nearby enemies back by [1].
While <LSTag Tooltip="Concentration">Concentrating</LSTag>, gain <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage.

Emit an aura across [1] granting both you and nearby allies the effects of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FEATHERFALL">Featherfall</LSTag>. If an ally moves out of range of the aura, the effects will persist for one turn.

Affected creature is emitting an aura across [1] granting both themselves and nearby allies the effects of Featherfall, protecting them from all non-lethal fall damage.

If an ally moves out of range of the aura, its effects will persist for one turn.
Affected creature has the effects of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FEATHERFALL">Featherfall</LSTag>, protecting them from all non-lethal fall damage.

After each Long Rest, gain three random Portent Dice. During the day, you can use your Reaction and a charge of your Arcane Recovery to change the die of any Attack Roll or Saving Throw rolled near you to that of one of your Portent Dice.

Each Portent Die can only be used once, and you lose your unused Portent Dice at the end of the day. Upon taking a Short Rest you will receive Prophecies for any spent Portent Dice. Complete these Prophecies to regain them.
Change the die of a nearby <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> to [1]. Bonuses and penalties are still added to the result.

When an enemy fails a <LSTag Tooltip="MeleeWeaponAttack">Melee Weapon Attack</LSTag> against you, use your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ReactionActionPoint">Reaction</LSTag> in order to retaliate with <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_ShockingGrasp">Shocking Grasp</LSTag>.
When an enemy fails a <LSTag Tooltip="MeleeWeaponAttack">Melee Weapon Attack</LSTag> against you, retaliate with <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_ShockingGrasp">Shocking Grasp</LSTag>.

Gain the ability to cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_Shield_Wizard">Shield</LSTag> by expending a charge of your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ArcaneRecoveryPoint">Arcane Recovery</LSTag>.

When an enemy fails an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> against you, use your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ReactionActionPoint">Reaction</LSTag> in order to retaliate with <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_FireBolt">Firebolt</LSTag>.
When an enemy fails an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> against you, retaliate with <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_FireBolt">Firebolt</LSTag>.
At the beginning of any combat encounter, immediately receive the effects of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="MIRROR_IMAGE_1">Mirror Image</LSTag>.

Gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag> based <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Checks</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>. Additionally, you add your <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Intelligence Modifier</LSTag> to all Charisma based <LSTag Tooltip="SkillCheck">Skill Checks</LSTag>.
You ignore elemental <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistances</LSTag> when dealing damage.
When dealing damage with a <LSTag Tooltip="Cantrip">Cantrip</LSTag>, deal additional damage equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> multiplied by two.

Spells you cast gain a damage bonus equal to 4 multiplied by the level of <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag> used. When targeting a creature with more than one projectile, only the first projectile will receive the additional damage.

Gain the ability to create an <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_WeaponBond">Arcane Bond</LSTag> between you and your weapons, restoring one charge of <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ArcaneRecoveryPoint">Arcane Recovery</LSTag> on every killing blow or <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag>.

Your melee or ranged weapons become magical, utilizing your Spellcasting Ability for Attack Rolls and damage.

Once per turn, upon killing another creature or landing a Critical Hit with your Bound Weapon, you restore one charge of Arcane Recovery.

Your melee weapons become magical, utilizing your Spellcasting Ability for Attack Rolls and damage.

Once per turn, upon killing another creature or landing a Critical Hit with your Bound Weapon, you restore one charge of Arcane Recovery.

Your ranged weapons become magical, utilizing your Spellcasting Ability for Attack Rolls and damage.

Once per turn, upon killing another creature or landing a Critical Hit with your Bound Weapon, you restore one charge of Arcane Recovery.

Affected weapon has become magical, utilizing its owners Spellcasting Ability for Attack Rolls and damage.

Once per turn, upon killing another creature or landing a Critical Hit with your Bound Weapon, you restore one charge of Arcane Recovery.

Upon landing a killing blow or <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag> on an enemy, restore one charge of <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ArcaneRecoveryPoint">Arcane Recovery</LSTag>. This effect can trigger once per turn.
While in combat, regenerate one charge of <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ArcaneRecoveryPoint">Arcane Recovery</LSTag> every three turns.
Affected creature will recover one charge of <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ArcaneRecoveryPoint">Arcane Recovery</LSTag> when this status expires.

Gain <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_TelekineticPush">Telekinetic Push</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_TelekineticPull">Telekinetic Pull</LSTag>. Once per turn, you may use either of these as a free action.
Push a target [1] away from you.

After making a melee based <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> or casting a Spell, you may cast a <LSTag Tooltip="Cantrip">Cantrip</LSTag> as a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">Bonus Action</LSTag>. This may be toggled at any time.
Affected creature may cast a <LSTag Tooltip="Cantrip">Cantrip</LSTag> as a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">Bonus Action</LSTag>.

Upon spending <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ArcaneRecoveryPoint">Arcane Recovery</LSTag> charges to recover <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slots</LSTag>, you gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on all damage rolls with Spells and Cantrips. The duration that you retain Advantage is equal to the level of Spell Slot recovered.
Affected creature rolls all damage of Spells and Cantrips with <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag>.
Reduce the number needed to roll a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag> with Spells and <LSTag Tooltip="Cantrip">Cantrips</LSTag> by 1.
